body_html:
I think this specific option (allow growth) should exist as an env-var flag. Consider the following common scenario:

I only own one machine, which has only one GPU. I sometimes want to run some random person's training code I got on github without it eating all my GPU memory. Because a little later, I want to start a notebook while the training is still running and still be able to do some tensorflow prototyping in it. While your monkey-patching trick is pretty neat, I'd like not to have to paste it into every code that I download.

My point being that whether to consume all GPU memory or not is much more a run-site setting than a code-site setting IMO.
